result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornelius Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Obtain or maintain full time employment

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 5-9-16
Pay DNA surcharge.

Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with any known drug users or anyone else who is convicted of a felony and on probation/parole.

Undergo assessments, treatments and counseling as recommended by agent.
Payment of all court obligations, restitution and supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
